instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ISL9239: What is ISL9239? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2016-2018 responsible for charging the battery and creating the power rail PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffee damage
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffee damage

after i clean the affected areas i manage to turn on this macbook i just having problems on battery that cant charge
even i change new battery. i just notice i didnt get voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL> with diode to ground 1.542
but i have voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> (<TRANSISTOR>Q5265</TRANSISTOR>) which is 13v

i decided to change <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> (intersil 9240HI) but i notice i used the intersil chip with 9239HI 
now the macbook cant turn on having 5.19V with 1.42a usb meter after this  i decided to put back the original <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> but i still getting 5.19V 
now i dont get voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> with diode to ground 0.485

i dont know what to do next. please advice me. thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffee damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffee damage
threads.message:
visual Check <TRANSISTOR>Q5230</TRANSISTOR>/40 looks ok this part not affected from coffee spill.

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_AON_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> |<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> 5.2V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AUX_DET</SIGNAL> 1.3V
VDDA 5.1V  VDDP 5.1V
<SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL> 0V 
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> 0V
all 0V is not shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffee damage
threads.message:
Probably bad <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, or bad solders.
I said to check <TRANSISTOR>Q5230</TRANSISTOR>/40, not to look them!
I hope <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP> didn't affect them.
Should not, but if you don't want to confirm, is your choice...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffee damage
threads.message:
bad <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>? i cant see this chip
<TRANSISTOR>Q5230</TRANSISTOR>/40 how to check? do u mean by replacing this two? 
anyway i didnt get any voltage from L5230 and there is no shortcircuit on this area specially <TRANSISTOR>Q5230</TRANSISTOR>/40 
there are chances to spoil this two <TRANSISTOR>Q5230</TRANSISTOR>/40 after replacing <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffee damage
threads.message:
Sorry, <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> in this case.

<TRANSISTOR>Q5230</TRANSISTOR>/40 can be checked like any other MOSFETs.
There are many sites on Internet, about how to check a MOSFET; Google helps you.

after i changed <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> came from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board,  now can on again, but im still not getting

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffee damage
threads.message:
What is the exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> voltage?
You are looking for <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL>, do you have the battery connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffee damage
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> 12.01V
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL> 0V without battery

<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL> 2.5V-3.2V looping with original battery (drained)
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL> 2.5V-3.2V looping with new battery with 70% change

using original 87watts usb c power adapter

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffee damage
threads.message:
So you are concerned to get 0V at <SIGNAL>PPBVBAT_AON</SIGNAL> without battery???
Why do you expect voltage there in such case?

Is that picture from the machine diagnosting in this thread?
